channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: You’ve Got a Public Reddit Profile. Here’s How to Curate It
item.description: Make your profile page look good—and make sure you’re not sharing more than you want to.

item.title: Protein Bars: Gluten-Free, Whole Foods, Fiber (2026)
item.description: What to prioritize, what to skip, when to enjoy—plus, we’ve selected WIRED's favorite bars worth trying.

item.title: Subtle releases ear buds with its noise cancelation models
item.description: Subtle's new $199 earbuds will also let you dictate in any app on desktop or phone

item.title: Plaud launches a new AI pin and a desktop meeting notetaker
item.description: Plaud is going after the likes of Granola to launch a desktop app that records online meetings

item.title: Subtle releases ear buds with its noise cancelation models
item.description: Subtle's new $199 earbuds will also let you dictate in any app on desktop or phone

item.title: A New Bridge Links the Strange Math of Infinity to Computer Science
item.description: Descriptive set theorists study the niche mathematics of infinity. Now, they’ve shown that their problems can be rewritten in the concrete language of...

item.title: 15 Best Electrolyte Powders (2026): Tasty and Effective
item.description: Get those lost minerals back with the help of our top picks.

item.title: French and Malaysian authorities are investigating Grok for generating sexualized deepfakes
item.description: France and Malaysia have joined India in condemning Grok for creating sexualized deepfakes of women and minors.

item.title: California residents can use new tool to demand brokers delete their personal data
item.description: A new tool should make it easier for California residents to limit data brokers’ ability to store and sell their personal information.

item.title: Tech billionaires cashed out $16 billion in 2025 as stocks soared
